conclusion: Initial velocity of the electron, charge of the electron, and mass of the electron are given.
The electric field between the two parallel metal plates is uniform and directed towards the right.
The electron's kinetic energy at point C can be calculated using the formula KE = 1/2mv^2.
The electron's velocity at point C can be found using the kinematic equation v^2 = v_{0}^2 + 2ad.
The electric field acceleration is given by a = qE/m.
The distance traveled in the electric field is given by d = v_{0}^2/(2a).
Substituting the values into the kinetic energy formula results in KE = 1/2m(v_{0}^4/(4a^2)).
The kinetic energy of the electron at point C is 1/32m = 1/32 × 0.91 × 10^{-30} kg × 1 J = 2.9 × 10^{-31} J.
